document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

040288B29D2D4395AAE7F321428516F4.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, and being read to. Respond to texts using
adjectives and connecting words (e.g., the conjunctions “like” and “because”).

253FC72A73504B3CB65CFDB6A450E775.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and
listening at the college and career-readiness level.

CABCB517E8A14F9584E6C39896DFABB9.description: Relate word meanings through similar words (synonyms) or opposites (antonyms).

8D7542FCEFF145C88E463A4BEDE5CABB.description:
Distinguish slight differences of meaning between verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or
choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

6404CFCF53EF4C759CF784E63A050703.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their usage (e.g., describe foods that are spicy or
juicy).

E0133BB2E37B4749B7EF35B0F2585468.description: Recognize word relationships and differences in word meanings.

DB4DDA1AADBB489BBCDAFD2AE2D73FC8.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

35357A78353F42CDAC82E53CA08672B4.description: Use compound words to derive meaning.

31C2DAE3357A480A834C532D50739146.description:
Use the root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g.,
addition/additional)

84F2BA9D158042C5B0114E9E7A5BA687.description:
Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g.,
looks/looked/looking).

1816DDAE86EC4F25B272D19D3B76832A.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word that is formed when a prefix is added to a known word
(e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

3487D9C719D14C7C9103AEC660F08DB5.description: Use illustrations, predictions, and context clues to help identify the meaning of a word or phrase.

7B597C61BA5A4677B169D3306131C6FB.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on class reading and
content area study, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

5B50CCCBC68B4CA28900BD58300793D0.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and
consulting reference materials.

5973EBEE82BF480292A9E229F1BB9954.description:
With support, apply differences between the conventions of spoken and written English with some
degree of accuracy though not perfectly.

5A14CDB5BD0F45748977C9E117F0B490.description:
Choose words and phrases for different purposes (e.g., slang, written vs. spoken, formal vs.
informal).

34F3747994CA45BFB4C86B614F508AFA.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

24D8D2AE862C47D2920D8DAEA6B40A9D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and
comprehension.

7EA039F074174DB59EFB39D321721394.description: Consult reference materials, including dictionaries, to check and correct spelling as needed.

7B09FE0CCBB3453E8021DE9698193C1E.description:
Use conventional spelling for grade-appropriate words with common spelling patterns and for
some irregular words.

BA8D2F2D934646449A3D3BA85942FEBA.description:
Use conventional spelling for basic sight words with common spelling patterns and for frequently
occurring irregular words (e.g., said = /s/ /e/ /d/).

15FE7D38D9094C5AB30AD7CE1D1790A1.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

5C50A87BFDF341799782078C8A04F31F.description:
Generalize learned spelling patterns (word families) when writing words (e.g., at: mat/cat/sat, ake:
cake/bake/make).

E7678051D5134AB4A95D9F1E87C29B7B.description: Write a letter or letters for short and long vowel sounds (phonemes).

298D0E611D2A4A079AC8D91DE950D245.description: Use punctuation for declarative, imperative, interrogative, and exclamatory sentences.

65BA2308A0AB4242B8B0871DCFC0679E.description: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.

FD418B8BCA924E1CBEAA4EF9D40F4C92.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

03B91BE8F1934F1793EDCD28C3F49463.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

8F92193CBA4C48EC9382962D4E95DD14.description:
Use articles (e.g., the, an, etc.) and demonstrative adjectives (e.g., this, that, etc.)
appropriately.

06F7090B4E8F4B58B360703057D65449.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).

71990F8C1DF6432ABC945963E00A0E90.description:
Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I/me/my, they/them/their,
anyone/everything).

13CB88DB069845219F2B71C1E847C148.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., in, on, under, in front, behind, next to).

ADA2024A073C42EEA13E1D7CF293ED3B.description: Use adjectives and adverbs to choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

C914EA4574A64A4D850859A53BE62827.description:
Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring regular verbs (e.g., want/wanted,
play/played).

94DDDBE0F0AF4C27977C857C522F7211.description: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

8B63A82183C54F38AFAA74103A384D74.description: Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).

6A4E78C4DA864470B29F5802F173F41A.description: Use collective nouns (e.g., group) and possessive nouns.

40E5756568B24DBBB3832EBEFB56ECD4.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing or speaking.

AF6E5FDA8E10450F8015706CBA515602.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

43474EE24EC44BF885866C91E294FA70.description:
With guidance and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, invented and creative writing,
and/or labeling a picture with a few words following a prompt.

663D86A03A1E4D6A933F111247DB97B7.description: Recall information to answer a question about a single topic.

A069B32BD9C540029B127BCC509A3BD1.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

D83F7817703E4024A90773A967DB7AB5.description:
Gather information from a variety of sources (literary and informational) to draw evidence from grade-level texts to
support answers to questions in writing.

2994F6B6E8F042EEBA783C337C38C1C2.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

F67D3A22354240B482F840A8A96E3BAB.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore several how-to books on a given
topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).

D6FFF9A422EB471F93FFB7623CF3E7ED.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., record science observations or read several books on a
single topic to produce a report).

A94489A3572248428B65EFC88D018BC8.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

FC510A0030C349108C4D0FCA1AD16020.description:
Use a multimedia element to enhance a written task. Multimedia elements may include, but are not limited to, drawings, pictures, artifacts, and audio or digital representations. At this grade level, the
multimedia element should relate to the task.

FA8900224D444BC082A25ED30DE4614C.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in
collaboration with peers.

6F6627C01B414EFB8617B8FF7F32ED49.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

B4D1198A5A5C4EA7956946E93FBD2739.description:
With guidance and support, brainstorm ideas for writing on a topic (e.g., additional text, drawings, visual displays,
labels) to strengthen writing.

AF475031A72A4A42B04EBC229E453A7A.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and
publishing).

EB1E846744D441DBA60B36290C54B086.description:
Collaborate with peers to draw and write literary texts. Use grade-level appropriate high-frequency words (e.g., sight words list) to write simple sentences (subject + verb + object) in short paragraphs of 3–5 sentences. (Include
4 or more words per sentence.)

37E0EFDB0FE74E489FB24B15DF76D161.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

21E28FFDD7004DCB867850A5E9F63B6E.description:
Work independently and collaborate with peers to draw and write informational texts. Use grade-level appropriate high-frequency words (e.g., sight words list) to write simple sentences (subject + verb + object) in
short paragraphs of 3–5 sentences. (Include 4 or more words per sentence.)

8E9D8030729C45AD92784610FECB4E58.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

AD74AA41D8BD4CE2B3C040E63ADCA5A0.description:
Write to express feelings, familiar topics, experiences and to describe a picture. Use grade-level appropriate high- frequency words (e.g., sight words list) to write simple sentences (subject + verb + object) in paragraphs of 3–5
sentences. (Include 4 or more words per sentence.)

2A26E27B408B46768947221411A8BB36.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

3882512F3B184A358340FB23BDD59A6C.description:
Read literary texts (e.g., folktale, realistic fiction, animal fantasy, legends, fairytales, poetry) and informational (e.g.,
science or social science articles) with purpose and understanding.

E0DDAE79C4CB45FEB0C78673F7AAA3CB.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

12E5058912F94673B8257549861EE40D.description:
Compare and contrast basic similarities and differences between two informational texts on the same
topic (e.g., illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

3E192F57CE46432F8B01433CA228E57F.description: Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

32A985A1BD664FF3915D7F2EADA1AB55.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

C4B7B61C2BF84379B71BD87B345966DA.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

C0B678B7545A4B5C87251B22F7DDB5A0.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

4D94370CE32741628B4A345CD040DEE8.description:
Use illustrations (picture cues) to identify story details and categorize similarities and differences
between characters and details within texts.

076F3121BC7A4ADCB3EB2CA358A200B8.description: Use titles, headings, and illustrations to predict and confirm text topics.

CBFC2EBA526D43ADA49A8DF2DBB244B9.description:
Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its
characters, setting, or plot.

D477BAAFB59E424B8F545BA9A6EFCDB1.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

0033740EA3AA4B31834FDD03B3DFF9F3.description: Distinguish information provided by illustrations (e.g., captions, charts, diagrams, graphs) in a text.

0C933066FC464DBDB1A538109FD88895.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

C1FC64CE59E949C4B9F246AEFE02BD3A.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

C74F99354CF14F44BD83B53645F24370.description: Describe the major differences between literary and informational texts.

922DF03346B14FF7BE25BA603A27EB5E.description:
Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections,
chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

18A7EE2AC37848B1BBDF4CF5B1B62E97.description:
Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in an
informational text.

D9EAB767F9BF4900BB8129C332A222FB.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

5C0A8C5C95E14182BAF1090629EB7499.description:
Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a literary text or use illustrations to help
determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a literary text.

79D6E55995FA47C7832620A22033ADCC.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

8F237EADA23C45C2A6E7261527ED5265.description:
Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in an
informational text.

7D86A8C695A34C59BFEBB2A9970D9DF6.description: Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.

9C05875C0A43485F966DFFC1390CD353.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

D0FFE144A1084800900B5B1075F77C0B.description: Identify the main topic and summarize key details of an informational text.

DF2F1175A3B64845AD63DA9337426F58.description: Identify main idea or lesson and summarize supporting details of the story.

3BF66F905C304A9996B6CE2EDEDAE1EC.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

3500A1C6AA4244808F6C517E3D25AFA3.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

9946B8D6788D49A4941653436AC53907.description:
With prompting and support, make predictions, describe ideas, phenomena (e.g., erosion), and textual elements (e.g., central message, character traits) using greater detail based on understanding a variety of grade-level and
read-aloud texts or multimedia resources.

90AE87EEDD264B7EABD98C60CFC7E48F.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

4C6B051697714BCAB60DEAF9B4845545.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

3579EF7F66534AEABD5D57B2EC161B2D.description:
Accurately read on-level texts orally with appropriate rate and expression on successive
readings.

CB52ED56BF0D4658A8ACB18214C15819.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

AE455D8CC5084FE8B11D212A28FF25AB.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

29DCA90DA75B4849ACDE6BB6A19A25CE.description: Read (100–150) high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

5CD5FDCBFEB642E38C3815201BFE3638.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

3692AA2A8BC4446085E371D19ACD73A2.description: Identify words with inconsistent but common spelling-sound correspondences.

AC609A38D48448A48F17C1AAB1CA738A.description: Decode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

B998CD20B7E74F05BC34CBFB10F522FA.description:
Decode two- to three-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into
syllables.

1F1A408402454639BF9C0C52A5332164.description: Decode regularly spelled two three-syllable words with long vowels.

EF25EB89A4A84B308A0E92B933BA7D05.description: Understand spelling-sound correspondences for additional common vowel teams.

27A8A63218594F7B879CDE5BEE176ED4.description: Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled monosyllabic words.

2BB879D78BD5457E9FDF6F36861FBD75.description:
Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode short and long sound patterns and
their variants both in isolation and in text.

0C3117151DF04CDB9AF85C1A734BC227.description: Segment spoken monosyllabic words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

2159B0789EA94934A91C2021ECFAAEFC.description:
Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken
monosyllabic words.

97D522CB206D4F2EA08441D83DEB177F.description:
Orally produce monosyllabic words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant
blends.

23F573FAD9A743AFA49F77950EE72764.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken monosyllabic words.

345E8CD886B5478796E282C487FB4B12.description:
Manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities, such as singing,
chanting, or participating in finger plays.

D192F090193A42A6A6B5D4680738A4A8.description: Recognize, match, and produce rhyming words, including nonsense words.

5172C09519C9408095B18F46D3DEA80A.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

EFC61D7A81DD493D9E0EA08F8FC70740.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

255754C28E27459EBE19116191732D9F.description:
Apply the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending
punctuation).

85EDA207C8D84C14B760361A8F251DC2.description: Recognize that print conveys specific meaning and that pictures may support meaning.

80774AC0D96B4894B311BC88D8475596.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

6B76EE778F204BEAA4CEE8368C70EB94.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

B7FE17E4FA0C460DAE0549C1125C4ECD.description: Recognize that the alphabet consists of consonants and vowels.

49525774A77849C78940E784C0B9924B.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

DB57C6832C4A421FB4866397BB9DAB1D.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

0D117FD5479A4204B33E135C001F9338.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

C7726A369A3D4484AD169152DA1A5EC3.description: Recite, memorize, or present more complex rhymes, poems, or songs.

832CE845590646BBA389C23F8B62C92D.description: Retell texts and recount experiences using complete sentences, key words, and a growing number of general, academic, and domain‐specific words to add detail while speaking.

CF6E7422BC504677BF1F068C6AD8A64D.description: Plan and deliver brief oral presentations on a variety of familiar topics using illustrations, words, phrases, or vocabulary from a text (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

E904744F4E474ED691325FA7C7B6C8F2.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

378FDB2A0C9D411FBDD6D30E0DA4749A.description:
Describe personal experiences using extended vocabulary with a growing number of nouns, noun phrases,
adjectives, and verbs to provide details appropriate to the situation.

38AFD833EDDB4A2F860E01FB4AB4B5F8.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

D7D71B20680343458E4DF5BF5E0FA1C7.description:
Share and elaborate on statements, opinions, or arguments using language models or sentence
starters (prompts) with increasing independence.

270D05C5592E4EAC8FEB5C687EAD7398.description:
Offer and support opinions by providing good reasons and increasingly detailed examples from experience and
texts.

F2892A54F7C943FBA576EBE58D2BB43B.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

D3E54FF547C54E86ACDA14BA93372887.description: Retell conversations and summarize fictional and informational texts. Respond to stories, read-alouds, and presentations orally using a growing number of general, academic, and content-specific words.

F5D9C1A1F9FD4F6BA4CA4AC40140D398.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

F30E03ED7C574E5592605D18065EB17A.description:
Expand sentences to provide details (e.g., time, manner, place, cause) in shared language
activities guided by the teacher and sometimes independently.

22ED63EF2C8847A781ECD9FA4CA44687.description:
Use words, phrases, and expanded sentences to express ideas for a variety of purposes (e.g., to
communicate needs and desires).

5E125474AA7C401B89AAAAE5E390AACA.description:
Exchange common social and more formal greetings, retell texts, and recount experiences using increasingly
detailed complete sentences.

BE999F50C6AF436F9BEBE452DC4AE5CD.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

9F8AF142CD7D436195F3F29FE4733828.description: Respond orally to closed- and open-ended questions.

396D8515FBF6477B81A1CBB188AF0A5A.description:
Participate in class, group, and partner discussions by listening attentively, following turn-taking rules, and asking and answering questions using complete sentences and demonstrating confidence about personal experience and
texts.

07CB0C7E94BA4701BE2C8D15603A78CA.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

28D45D94DE264FB2BEA45E06A91060A0.description:
Repeat and respond to chants, poems, songs, and rhymes using phrases, physical movements,
etc.

18457A8149C340FA9611E615297AC82C.description: Offer and respond to greetings/farewells using appropriate courtesy expressions.

45A0CD96FD0C4038B6B316B88EC18A9B.description: Listen and respond to simple and increasingly complex instructions, commands, and directions.

C0EFF0A15BC746528D1D71FB66130784.description:
Use gestures, expressions, and simple words/phrases to demonstrate engagement and
understanding in a socially appropriate manner.

F73CB55A5FDE4A8D97C51988E611F86D.description:
Ask and answer questions appropriate to the topic and offer opinions in conversations using
learned phrases and open responses.

0F5CFF36ECC7487C89EDB1AC05003800.description: Listen and respond to simple 5W and 1H questions.

BFDF766D5E6347A2844688E3E90A2ED6.description:
Listen to and interact with peers during social interactions; read-alouds (fiction and nonfiction texts); oral
presentations; and class, group, and partner discussions.

13FF2BE3CD224EAF8A0A47C7C303F695.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
